meanings.definition: An act of blocking or obstructing.
meanings.sent1: The blockage in the road caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent2: I removed the blockage from the drain to allow the water to flow freely.
meanings.sent3: The blockage in the pipe played a prank on the plumber.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness was a blockage to progress in the project.
meanings.sent5: The blockage in the tunnel made it impossible for cars to pass through.

meanings.sent1: The fallen tree was a blockage on the hiking trail.
meanings.sent2: She used a rock as a blockage to hold the door open.
meanings.sent3: The blockage of leaves in the gutter created a mini obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: Miscommunication acted as a blockage to their understanding.
meanings.sent5: The blockage of ice in the river caused a temporary dam.

meanings.definition: The state of being blocked or obstructed.
meanings.sent1: The blockage of the website prevented access to important information.
meanings.sent2: The blockage of the pipe resulted in a water backup.
meanings.sent3: The blockage of the door made it impossible to enter the room.
meanings.sent4: Her fear was a blockage to her achieving her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The blockage of traffic during rush hour caused delays for commuters.
